parameters: \pop[2]As we drive down the highway, I recognize some of the sights.
\pop[2]We passed these places when Isaac picked me up from the airport.
\pop[2]That almost feels like a lifetime ago, though. How different things were...
\pop[3]Here, you gotta take off that shirt and jacket.
\pop[2]We all guide him out of his clothing, and get a better look at the wound.
\pop[2]The highway makes things a bit shaky, but I think we'll be fine.
\pop[4]No, too risky. We'll have to patch him up and leave it inside.
\pop[4]We could do more damage, and infect it.
Best bet is to close it up and stop the bleeding.
\pop[3]So we have to stitch him up? In a moving vehicle?
Call it even for ditching us.
\pop[2]He grabs the bottle of booze resting beside him.
\pop[2]Isaac opens up the bottle, and takes a massive swig.
\pop[3]No, I meant pour it on the wound!
\pop[2]Isaac turns the bottle upside down, pouring several shots worth on his body.
\pop[3]It might. I saw it in a movie.
Here, let's get that kit open.
\pop[2]Klace grabs Isaac's shirt and holds it over the wound.
\pop[3]So, just stitch it up, and dress it.
\pop[2]Isaac taps my arm, and holds up his hand.
\pop[2]I grab it, and squeeze tight. This was definitely gonna hurt.
\pop[4]You gotta tell us why we're doing this, man.
Isaac told us to trust you. But why?
\pop[2]The grip on my hand tightens as Taylor starts to stitch him up.
\pop[2]I try not to look. It wouldn't be a pretty sight, after all.
\pop[3]The one you took all the music from?
What \c[14]actually\c[0] happens in my vision, is...
And this woman comes up to me, and...
\pop[2]He grabs his scarf and tugs on it, tightening it slightly around his neck.
\pop[2]That simple, almost comical gesture, was enough for us to get the idea.
\pop[4]Isaac, you have \c[14]got\c[0] to destroy that drive.
If you don't, she'll come after us!
\pop[2]That seems to be enough for Dante to stop.
\pop[2]Since I read Klace's diary, however, I understand this even more.
\pop[2]In his vision, he's killed by the leader of \c[10]Argus\c[0]...? That's unbelievable.
\pop[2]And not only that, but had a business card for the \c[10]Vision Protection Program\c[0].
\pop[2]He must've thought that the program could help him escape his fate.
\pop[2]But when the entire corporation was run by his killer?
\pop[2]Well, I guess it felt like there was nowhere to hide.
\pop[2]I can't even imagine what he's feeling right now.
\pop[2]The \c[14]only\c[0] program that could help him, was owned by her...
\pop[2]Almost explains why he was so willing to take a bullet for all of us.
\pop[2]He clearly thinks that there's no way to avoid his death, now.
\pop[2]If anyone wanted revenge against us, it would definitely be \c[14]her\c[0].
\pop[2]Isaac's grip tightens on my hand again, before finally letting go.
\pop[3]Now let's get him in a new shirt, and bandage him up.
Just be careful, it's one of my favorites.
\pop[2]We help Isaac into a new shirt, and then Taylor wraps him up.
\pop[2]He both looks, and sounds, a \c[14]lot\c[0] better than mere minutes ago.
\pop[2]Grabbing the bottle of whiskey, he takes another large swig.
\pop[2]We all sit back, and let out a collective sigh of relief.
\pop[2]Isaac would be fine. We'd just have to monitor him.
\pop[3]So let's get back to this \c[14]leader\c[0] thing...
In fact, she seems sad while she's doing it.
\pop[3]It's \c[14]gotta\c[0] have something to do with that drive.
Especially since you mirrored the files to a bunch of other servers.
\pop[4]Yeah. Had to take a page out of Isaac's playbook.
He did a good job in that final standoff with The Thorns.
Well, except for the dagger part. Still don't agree with \c[14]that\c[0] one.
\pop[3]We just need to destroy that drive, then.
They'd have no reason to come after us anymore.
Especially now that the entire \c[14]world\c[0] knows our faces.
\pop[2]He seems proud as he says that. Like the exposure would help his career.
\pop[7]That's a looooot of info to throw away, though...
I mean, \c[14]every\c[0] secret we've ever wanted to know?
\pop[2]That seems to be the note that this conversation ends on.
\pop[2]We clearly had to get to safety, and destroy the drive.
\pop[2]Doing so, it seemed, would prevent Klace's vision.
\pop[2]But now, almost everything about Klace made perfect sense.
\pop[2]All the booze, the tranquilizers, and gummies he started to consume.
\pop[2]He was using drugs to try and suppress his horrible vision.
\pop[2]Being forced to live your death almost \c[14]every\c[0] day?
\pop[2]I'd seek almost any form of relief within my grasp.
\pop[2]No, I don't want to think about it.
\pop[2]We could protect him, and make sure it doesn't happen.
\pop[2]Of course, he'd still have to live it. Almost every single day.
\pop[2]I start to panic, just from the thought of it.
\pop[2]I grab Isaac's hand, and he squeezes it, as if trying to console me.
\pop[3]Just take a left up here, and keep going straight.
Do we have to do anything special to pass the wall, Isaac?
\pop[3]You modded your car to do that?
\pop[2]We sit in silence for the rest of the way, letting Isaac rest and relax.
\pop[2]Beforehand, going to a colony meant that you could \c[14]never\c[0] return.
\pop[2]But now, things have changed. I think we'd be allowed to go home.
\pop[2]So, the goal was clear. Wait out any trouble, and destroy the drive.
\pop[2]Hopefully I could talk to my friends a little bit, and hear how they're feeling.
\pop[2]The raid on Argus HQ shook us \c[14]all\c[0] up. Everyone is just acting fine.
\pop[2]A little while longer, the car comes to a complete stop.
\pop[2]The sun has set, and I have no idea where we are.
\pop[3]Let me get out first. I'll start a fire.
You're probably not used to this kind of cold.
\pop[4]Alright, we'll wait until we see it.
